data.title: TD Napalm bomb hits ground instantly
data.body: Regression from #12405 (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/commit/f30f47de4f85aca8321442e1dd881dab2902715a).

data.title: Add projectile shadows to TD
data.body:
TD has received little attention this release cycle (except for the major balancing overhaul and upcoming map pool overhaul, of course), so we should at least match RA regarding projectile shadows.

Now that weapons use inheritance, this should be fairly easy to do.

data.title: Official Map Pool Overhaul for TD
data.body:
It's time to do a map overhaul for Tiberium Dawn - it has stayed unchanged for way too long, and it is just horrific.

Most experienced players play the custom maps and the new players are stuck with the really bad maps. It's hurting our image.

Includes:

1. **Added 42 maps**
- 2p Antrax
- 2p Battlefield
- 2p Frontal Assault
- 2p Golden Nuggets (2P)
- 4p Braided River
- 4p Burning Hammer
- 4p Desert Storm III
- 4p Desert Storm V
- 4p Douze
- 4p Golden Nuggets (4P)
- 4p Guarana
- 4p Lost Forest
- 4p N/S Manufacturing Consent
- 4p Ping Pong Bay
- 4p Riverside Frontline
- 4p Search & Destroy
- 4p Sustain
- 4p Tiberian War (4P)
- 4p Too Hot
- 4p Valhalla
- 4p WarKraft
- 6p Alpha Juno V
- 6p Axis of Advance
- 6p Back to Basics (6P)
- 6p Botany
- 6p Control & Chaos
- 6p Golden Nuggets (6P)
- 6p Kolosseum
- 6p Sonatine
- 6p Tiberian War (6P)
- 8p Back to Basics (8P)
- 8p Control & Chaos
- 8p Golden Nuggets (8P)
- 8p Ground Zero
- 8p Order of Battle (8P)
- 8p Tiberium Connected
- 8p Twisted Peak
- 8p Vectors of Battle (8P)
- 10p Golden Nuggets (10P)
- 10p Order of Battle (10p)
- 10p Vectors of Battle (10P)
- 12p Golden Nuggets (12P)

2. **tweaked 10 maps** (author name, map name, tiberium trees)
- 2p Aggressive Tendencies
- 2p Avocado
- 2p Lost Souls
- 4p Escalations
- 4p Manufactoring Consent
- 4p Treasure Island
- 6p Haos Ridges
- 6p Vectors of Battle (6P)
- 8p Pressure
- 16p Morbid Aimless Poseidon


3. **removed 23 maps**
- 2p Chokepoint
- 2p Dead in Motion 2
- 2p Profit Over People
- 2p Sandstorm
- 2p Sea and Cake
- 2p The Hourglass
- 2p The Sentinel
- 2p Two Ponds
- 4p Break of Day
- 4p Deterring Democracy +
- 4p Hegemony or Survivor
- 4p Llamas
- 4p Minus Two
- 4p Mt.Nukebait
- 4p Necessary Illusions
- 4p Rogue States
- 4p Tiberium Oasis
- 4p White Acres
- 6p East vs West 3
- 6p Into the River Below
- 6p Llamas 2
- 8p Crossing the Rubicon
- 8p Hegemony or Survival 8P

[TD Map Pool thread on the forum.](http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=19904)

data.title: WithIdleOverlay ticks it's frames even when hidden via conditions.
Add support for per-source and total external condition caps.
data.body:
This removes the concept of an "external condition" from `ConditionManager`, instead having the `ExternalCondition` trait act as an intermediary.  `ExternalCondition` keeps track of the different external sources, and can be configured with caps on the total and per-source condition levels that are granted.

Fixes #12720.

data.title: Use external mod switching plumbing to restart after settings changes.
data.body:
This ensures that the correct engine arguments are passed to the game.
Fixes #12787.

data.title: Utility: Available mod list regression
data.body:
At the time of writing this bleed was eaf55a864c58ac27bdaf9251603131e5c9d0dab4.

```
[20:34:54] <Phrohdoh> The utility doesn't currently support mod search paths, correct?
[20:35:19] <pchote> it doesn't need to
[20:35:23] <pchote> you pass the direct path to the mod
[20:35:58] <pchote> Game.Mod=$(moddir)
[20:37:33] <Phrohdoh> Is this the expected behaviour when no mod is passed (the empty mod list)? [gist content below]
```

```
thill@tmba /Users/.../mods/ra2 $ mono engine/OpenRA.Utility.exe
Run `OpenRA.Utility.exe [MOD]` to see a list of available commands.
The available mods are:

thill@tmba /Users/.../mods/ra2 $ mono engine/OpenRA.Utility.exe mods/ra2 | head
Run `OpenRA.Utility.exe [MOD]` to see a list of available commands.
The available mods are: all, cnc, d2k, modchooser, ra, ts, ra2

  --argb2hex
  Convert a,r,g,b legacy colors into hex colors

  --check-code-style DIRECTORY
  Check the *.cs source code files in a directory for code style violations.

  --check-explicit-interfaces
```

```
[20:38:30] <pchote> well I guess you've deleted all the other mods?
[20:38:51] <Phrohdoh> nope
[20:39:18] <Phrohdoh> the engine submodule points to openra proper and isn't changed locally
[20:39:38] <pchote> huh, you're right
[20:40:29] <pchote> works on a non-submoduled bleed though
[20:40:53] <pchote> wait no
[20:40:56] <pchote> I wasn't on bleed
[20:40:59] <pchote> bleed is broken
[20:41:36] <pchote> regression from #12765
[20:41:37] <orabot> Pull request #12765 (closed) by pchote: Clean up stale metadata registrations. | http://bugs.openra.net/12765
```

ref #12765

data.title: Throw an InvalidOperationException when a mod manifest references a bogus package
data.body:
Closes #12789

---

Bogus packages are packages that:
  * Cannot be located on disk
  * Are of an unsupported format

---

This should be merged because it takes us from
```
Exception of type `System.ArgumentNullException`: Value cannot be null.
Parameter name: key
  at System.ThrowHelper.ThrowArgumentNullException (System.ExceptionArgument argument) [0x00006] in <829ce140006e4cad9124766ee7f51179>:0
  at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2[TKey,TValue].FindEntry (TKey key) [0x0000b] in <829ce140006e4cad9124766ee7f51179>:0
  at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2[TKey,TValue].TryGetValue (TKey key, TValue& value) [0x00000] in <829ce140006e4cad9124766ee7f51179>:0
  at OpenRA.FileSystem.FileSystem.Mount (OpenRA.FileSystem.IReadOnlyPackage package, System.String explicitName) [0x00004] in <f7acde33042c4e48b81a545ce4cfd61b>:0
```
to
```
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Could not open package 'foo.bar', there is no support for this format.
  at OpenRA.FileSystem.FileSystem.Mount (System.String name, System.String explicitName) [0x000b8] in /Users/thill/projects/play/openra/OpenRA.Game//FileSystem/FileSystem.cs:127
```

when an unsupported filetype is added to the packages list in a mod manifest.

---

### How to test this:

1) Add a `foo.bar` package reference to RA's manifest.
2) Create the `foo.bar` file in RA's content directory.
3) Launch the RA mod.

data.title: FileSystem.Mount(string, string?) should check `package` for null before attempting to mount
data.body:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/eaf55a864c58ac27bdaf9251603131e5c9d0dab4/OpenRA.Game/FileSystem/FileSystem.cs#L126

Currently you get an `ArgumentNullException`, from `Dictionary.TryGetValue` which isn't helpful.

```
Exception of type `System.ArgumentNullException`: Value cannot be null.
Parameter name: key
  at System.ThrowHelper.ThrowArgumentNullException (System.ExceptionArgument argument) [0x00006] in <829ce140006e4cad9124766ee7f51179>:0
  at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2[TKey,TValue].FindEntry (TKey key) [0x0000b] in <829ce140006e4cad9124766ee7f51179>:0
  at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2[TKey,TValue].TryGetValue (TKey key, TValue& value) [0x00000] in <829ce140006e4cad9124766ee7f51179>:0
  at OpenRA.FileSystem.FileSystem.Mount (OpenRA.FileSystem.IReadOnlyPackage package, System.String explicitName) [0x00004] in <f7acde33042c4e48b81a545ce4cfd61b>:0
```

data.title: "Restart now" settings option doesn't work with externally launched mods.
data.body:
From IRC:

> [04:32:41]	<Phrohdoh> pchote: not sure where this should be reported, or it is known but... with the mod template if you change a setting and pick "restart now" the game will be reloaded and won't load the expected engine instance (not sure where it is going wrong), but it won't be able to find the external mods so I am stuck on a blank modchooser menu (black because I'
[04:32:41]	<Phrohdoh> ve disabled all non-ra2 mods as a test) 

I suspect the cleanest fix will be to use the external switching logic (switch to itself) and remove the now-redundant special-case restart code.

data.title: Does not run properly on Wayland
data.body:
SDL has experimental Wayland support since version 2.0.2 according to [Wayland's wiki](https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/wayland#SDL). I tried it out, but I only see the lower left corner of the game.  

```
$ SDL_VIDEODRIVER=wayland openra
Platform is Linux
Using SDL 2 with OpenGL renderer
Desktop resolution: 3200x1800
No custom resolution provided, using desktop resolution
Using resolution: 3200x1800
Using window scale 1.00
OpenGL version: 3.0 Mesa 13.0.3
Using default sound device
Cannot connect to server socket err = No such file or directory
Cannot connect to server request channel
jack server is not running or cannot be started
JackShmReadWritePtr::~JackShmReadWritePtr - Init not done for 4294967295, skipping unlock
JackShmReadWritePtr::~JackShmReadWritePtr - Init not done for 4294967295, skipping unlock
Available mods:
	cnc: Tiberian Dawn (release-20161019)
	d2k: Dune 2000 (release-20161019)
	modchooser: Mod Chooser (release-20161019)
	ra: Red Alert (release-20161019)
Loading mod: cnc
```

See also the attached screenshot.

![screenshot from 2017-02-14 10-43-13](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/551904/22923642/95c54a5a-f2a2-11e6-845c-92a6d3096f85.png)

data.title: Does not run on Wayland
data.body:
I know that Wayland support is not official or anything but given that it will be the future, it might be useful to start having a look at it (also considering all HiDPI issues).  SDL has experimental support for Wayland according to [their wiki](https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/wayland#SDL), so, I tried it out:

```
$ SDL_VIDEODRIVER=wayland openra
Using SDL 2 with OpenGL renderer
Desktop resolution: 0x0
No custom resolution provided, using desktop resolution
Using resolution: 0x0
Renderer initialization failed. Check graphics.log for details.
Using SDL 2 with OpenGL renderer
Desktop resolution: 0x0
No custom resolution provided, using desktop resolution
Using resolution: 0x0
Renderer initialization failed. Check graphics.log for details.
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Failed to initialize platform-integration library. Check graphics.log for details.
  at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) [0x0010d] in <e8e2e8fbcf8043d0bde34796e2e884f1>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00007] in <e8e2e8fbcf8043d0bde34796e2e884f1>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x0004f] in <e8e2e8fbcf8043d0bde34796e2e884f1>:0 
```

These are the contents of `graphics.log`:
```
System.InvalidOperationException: Can not create OpenGL context. (Error: Video subsystem has not been initialized)
  at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.Sdl2GraphicsDevice..ctor (System.Drawing.Size windowSize, OpenRA.WindowMode windowMode) [0x00200] in <a3acf6cc902d43d4b76e4650252e267e>:0 
  at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.DefaultPlatform.CreateGraphics (System.Drawing.Size size, OpenRA.WindowMode windowMode) [0x00001] in <a3acf6cc902d43d4b76e4650252e267e>:0 
  at OpenRA.Renderer..ctor (OpenRA.IPlatform platform, OpenRA.GraphicSettings graphicSettings) [0x0002e] in <e8e2e8fbcf8043d0bde34796e2e884f1>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) [0x001af] in <e8e2e8fbcf8043d0bde34796e2e884f1>:0 
System.InvalidOperationException: Can not create OpenGL context. (Error: Video subsystem has not been initialized)
  at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.Sdl2GraphicsDevice..ctor (System.Drawing.Size windowSize, OpenRA.WindowMode windowMode) [0x00200] in <a3acf6cc902d43d4b76e4650252e267e>:0 
  at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.DefaultPlatform.CreateGraphics (System.Drawing.Size size, OpenRA.WindowMode windowMode) [0x00001] in <a3acf6cc902d43d4b76e4650252e267e>:0 
  at OpenRA.Renderer..ctor (OpenRA.IPlatform platform, OpenRA.GraphicSettings graphicSettings) [0x0002e] in <e8e2e8fbcf8043d0bde34796e2e884f1>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) [0x001af] in <e8e2e8fbcf8043d0bde34796e2e884f1>:0 
```

I want to add that OpenRA works fine with Xwayland, except that the scroll wheel doesn't seem to be working?

data.title: Move Westwood file formats to Mods.Cnc/D2k
data.body:
Basically blocked by our current Vqa support setup.

- [ ] `Scripting\Media.cs` calls `VqaReader` directly
- [ ] `Scripting\Global\MediaGlobal.cs` calls `VqaReader` directly
- [ ] `AssetBrowserLogic` needs `VqaPlayerWidget`, which also calls `VqaReader`
- [ ] `MissionBrowserLogic` needs `VqaPlayerWidget`, which also calls `VqaReader`

Note: `ShpTS` and `RLEZerosCompression` should remain in `Common` as discussed on IRC, as ShpTS has the best community tool support (and its `RLEZerosCompression` is non-proprietary).

data.title: Complete OpenRA Video Game Trailer for OpenRA's 10th Anniversary (June 19th, 2017)
data.body:
June 19th marks the 10th Anniversary for OpenRA:
OpenRA's first commit: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/commit/b59ba43934a3a6837410db51cf60157cf854e52d

This issue is here to collaborate various aspects of the video making process.

Aim of producing the complete video is June 4th (Sunday) around 2 weeks before the Anniversary date.

The final product will be uploaded to the official OpenRA channels (YouTube, Facebook...).

- - - - - - - -

This video project started around November 2014 with #6891 but stalled at the end of 2015 due to other commitments taking precedence up until today. In order to avoid the same trap I'll be season forfeiting the league and cut down the Monday streams down to every other week starting with Monday March 13th.

- - - - - - - -

Product so far:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/ih2tlyhgx2eyfnv/Produced_177.mp4?dl=0

Topics to cover (will flesh this out during this week):

- Total video time: 2m:04s of which 1m:15s is produced and 0m:49s remaining.
- Sealed intro sequence. Possible alteration with new text/theme/style.

- [x] Re-shoot outdated game-play sequences.
- [x] Remaining content.
- [x] Redo intro and replace text graphics.
- [x] Tweak/add effects.
- [x] Outtro/End title.

data.title: D2k missing z offset of infantry
data.body:
Infantry with 0 z-offset for their armament in prone position will shoot "into" the ground and won't damage itself or the enemy during this time.


![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20945684/22879323/c9a6f2da-f1dd-11e6-8bf5-d7d0ba84746f.png)

Units with 0 z-offset in D2K:
Infantry:
- [ ] Light Infantry
- [ ] Fremen
- [ ] Sardaukar


Vehicles:
- [ ] Raider
- [ ] Combat Tank
